issue.title: www.outbrain.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.outbrain.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.outbrain.com%2F) ### Comment > Zabawna sprawa. Bo zazwyczaj blokuje się Outbraina, ale ja muszę się tam logować ze względów zawodowych. ALe mimo tego, że dodaje reguły niestandardowe `(@@||www.outbrain.com^$important` > `@@||outbrain.com^$important` > `@@||my.outbrain.com^$important)` to nie jestem w stanie się tam zalogować i zawsze dostaje komunikat przeglądarki ERR_ADDRESS_INVALID. Jakiś pomysł co mam dodać w regułach, żeby Adguard pozwlił mi się tam dostac. ``` Username: @BRLosiu ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/j727hnmqoc8wc44wck4s8kkk0oksk8w1h1ppzt5kmg.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/et1c5iktbhkooggcg0gkg8k8g00gkcok85ke35lngg.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- Platform: | OPNSense with Adguard addon v0.107.64 System version: | `OPNSense` Browser: | Chrome Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base Other extensions used: | `Eset Internet Security`

comment.body: Glad it works now. You are welcome.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

issue.title: nust.edu.pk

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [https://nust.edu.pk/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnust.edu.pk%2F)
### Comment
> Whenever Adguard Default Public DNS is configured in Chrome's own settings (DNS over HTTPS), the mentioned website doesn't load BUT when the Adguard Default Public DNS is configured in Android's Private DNS settings, the website loads successfully.

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/91ilywumcsw8o0gksso800coccw04s8m6xa3duoea8.png?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/eip1rpcannk0kocc84ooskcscc4ksso7eysutlg9so.png?nc=1)
</details>

### System configuration

Information | Value
--- | ---
AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS
DNS setup: | Chrome Browser
DNS server: | AdGuard DNS Default server
System version: | `Android 13`
Browser: | Chrome

comment.body:
@zloyden customer says: `For the domain nust.edu.pk, I noticed that it loaded when I configured Adguard Default DNS in Android's Private DNS BUT is unable to load whenever Adguard DNS is configured in DoH settings of Chrome (Android), Firefox (Android & Windows).`

Can it be some browser settings?

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: nust.edu.pk

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [https://nust.edu.pk/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnust.edu.pk%2F)
### Comment
> Whenever Adguard Default Public DNS is configured in Chrome's own settings (DNS over HTTPS), the mentioned website doesn't load BUT when the Adguard Default Public DNS is configured in Android's Private DNS settings, the website loads successfully.

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/91ilywumcsw8o0gksso800coccw04s8m6xa3duoea8.png?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/eip1rpcannk0kocc84ooskcscc4ksso7eysutlg9so.png?nc=1)
</details>

### System configuration

Information | Value
--- | ---
AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS
DNS setup: | Chrome Browser
DNS server: | AdGuard DNS Default server
System version: | `Android 13`
Browser: | Chrome

comment.body:
> [@zloyden](https://github.com/zloyden) customer says: `For the domain nust.edu.pk, I noticed that it loaded when I configured Adguard Default DNS in Android's Private DNS BUT is unable to load whenever Adguard DNS is configured in DoH settings of Chrome (Android), Firefox (Android & Windows).`
> 
> Can it be some browser settings?

Same situation occur with other browsers. Even on Desktop, when AdGuard DNS was configured at browser level, the website didn't load BUT when used system-wide configuration, the website loaded.
I think something is happening behind-the-scene while resolving the IP. As some of my tests showed that the domain owner is using Cloudflare for the IP resolution or something related to it. Moreover, Firefox was giving PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR which is explained by some sources as:
The PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR in Firefox indicates that the secure connection to the website was unexpectedly terminated by the server or a network intermediary.
Thank you.

comment.body:
It seems that your OS is too old to unable to receive new web technology like native `:has()` CSS support. [^1]
The native `:CSS()` support is required to resolve your issue. And the related filters using the native `:has()` CSS already exist in the AdGuard Popup filters list.
Therefore, please upgrade your Windows OS to Windows 11 OR use any latest Linux desktop distro.

[^1]: Any Windows users that uses Windows 7, 8 or 8.1 can update their Firefox version to up to 115 ESR. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/firefox-users-windows-7-8-and-81-moving-extended-support?pubDate=20250811 However, supporting native `:has()` CSS of Firefox has been started with Firefox 121. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:has

comment.body: Tested with Safari Version 18.6 (20621.3.11.11.3) on macOS X 15.6.1 (24G90), and AdGuard Version 2.17.3.2020 release, and turning each feature off individually (while leaving the others enabled): * without Tracking Protection module: ✅ * without DNS filtering: ✅ * without all filters: ✅ ❌ = login to alltrails.com failed ✅ = login to alltrails.com succeeded Surprisingly, after I re-enabled all of these settings, login continued to work after originally throwing a 400 "malformed request" error in the Google sign in popup window. Perhaps the act of disabling then enabling each setting somehow "fixed" an erroneous configuration, or forced AdGuard to refresh a corrupted cache or something?

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
